H0.text: Flowers are the structure that all plants, even when different from each other, have in common.

H1.text: Fruit is the structure that all plants have in common, even though plants that are different from each other may have similar structures.

H2.text: Roots are the structure that all plants have in common, even though different plants may have similar structures.

H3.text: Trunks are the structure that all plants have in common, even though plants that are different from each other may have similar structures.

A4.text: In vascular plants, the roots are the organs of a plant that are modified to provide anchorage for the plant and take in water and nutrients into the plant body, which allows plants to grow taller and faster.
